meanings.definition: A person who bends their body forward and downward.
meanings.sent1: The stoopers in the garden were picking up fallen leaves.
meanings.sent2: The group of stoopers were searching for something on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The stoopers looked like they were playing a game of 'who can touch their toes first'.
meanings.sent4: The stoopers resembled a row of human question marks.
meanings.sent5: The image of the stoopers bending over was etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: To bend one's body forward and downward.
meanings.sent1: She stoopers down to tie her shoelaces.
meanings.sent2: The old man stoopers to pick up the fallen pen.
meanings.sent3: The cat stoopers low to sneak up on the unsuspecting mouse.
meanings.sent4: The flowers stoopers towards the sunlight in the morning.
meanings.sent5: He stoopers to examine the tiny insect on the ground.

meanings.definition: A low, overhanging beam or lintel.
meanings.sent1: Watch out for the stoopers when entering the old building.
meanings.sent2: The stoopers in the barn were a hazard for tall visitors.
meanings.sent3: The stoopers in the doorway made the tall man duck his head.
meanings.sent4: The stoopers in the ancient temple were adorned with intricate carvings.
meanings.sent5: The stoopers in the tunnel added a sense of mystery to the passage.
